chapter.title: Additional resources for integrating digital literacy activities into instruction
chapter.content:
Activities that foster digital literacy are critical to workforce preparation under WIOA and echoed in the Employability Skills Framework. TIF, described earlier in this course, maintains a steady focus on incorporating digital literacy skill-building into all sample activities.

Given that integrating technology and teaching digital literacy skills are so important yet still emergent practices in adult education, this topic highlights some additional resources teachers of adult learners can use to integrate digital literacy activities into their current curriculum, including the:

  • LINCS Digital Literacy webpage;
  • Tech Tips for Teachers blog; and
  • Teaching Excellence in Adult Literacy (TEAL) resources.

chapter.title: LINCS digital literacy web page offers resources for students, teachers, and programs
chapter.content:
The U.S. Department of Education funds digital literacy initiatives that are designed to enhance the integration of technology into adult education instruction. The LINCS Digital Literacy web page offers a wide range of free resources for students, teachers, and adult education programs that aim to increase student access to technology and leverage learning outside the classroom.

Integrating Technology in the Adult Education Classroom is a self-paced course that provides strategies, approaches, and tools for integrating technology. Note that this course requires users to log in to the LINCS Learning Portal.

chapter.title: Blog helps adult educators use technology to foster digital literacy
chapter.content:
Teachers, professional developers, and subject matter experts around the country have contributed to the Tech Tips for Teachers blog, hosted by the EdTech Center at World Education. The goal of the blog is to help adult educators use technology to aid instruction and foster digital literacy.

The blog archive (2014 – 2016) offers a lesson index that allows users to select classroom-ready activities according to instructional content and topics, such as:

  • reading and writing;
  • vocabulary and grammar;
  • speaking and listening;
  • math and numeracy;
  • digital literacy;
  • science;
  • organizing information; and
  • career explorations.

The blog includes:

  • hands-on ideas for integrating technology into adult education;
  • updates from the field; and
  • best practices.

The range of topics reflects the blog’s focus on integrating technology rather than merely using technology. That is, when technology is used in the service of content instruction and is aimed not just at teaching the mechanics of technology use, it supports and enhances learning, communication, collaboration and problem solving, and subsequently workforce preparation skills, in all subject areas.

chapter.title: TEAL center promotes a variety of research-based practices
chapter.content:
OCTAE’s Teaching Excellence in Adult Literacy (TEAL) Center is designed to improve the quality of teaching in adult education by promoting a variety of research-based practices.

TEAL features guides for teaching writing and math and a series of 12 Fact Sheets that suggest how research on a variety of educational issues, including technology-supported writing instruction, can be readily applied to teaching practices.

In addition, TEAL provides resources for enhancing teaching and learning through effective use of technology and offers strategies for using and sharing technology solutions programs where little to no instructional technology is available (such as correctional facilities).
